p: When 35% BWOC of SF is added (sample S35NC0), the samples permeability at high-temperature condition decreased by 23.68% and 27.78% after 7 and 28 days, respectively, compared to the same sample when cured at 38 Â°C for the whole curing period ( Table 6). This result is attributed to voids filling up due to matrix expansion as the temperature increases as noticed for concrete mortars saturated with silica particles by Farzadnia et al. [ 40] and because of transformation of the CH to more stable forms of C-S-H as reported by Heikal et al. [ 41] and Heikal [ 42].
